Reviews.Title: “Good little hotel with handy location for Place D'Italie metro”
Reviews.Author: EscritorManchester
Reviews.Content: Nice simple hotel, close to metro. You can be by the Eiffel tower in under 20 minutes. Rooms are small but this is normal for central Paris. Hotel staff are polite and helpful. We didn't eat breakfast here so can't comment if it was good or bad. We ate at Cafe O Jules near Place D'Italie which did a continental breakfast for 7E which was cheaper than the hotel's 12E. I'd recommend Cafe O Jules for evening meals too. They are child friendy and have a children's menu.

Reviews.Title: “very budget”
Reviews.Author: Skelshy
Reviews.Content: hard beds. wifi flaky. shoebox rooms. cleans. have to leave keys with receptionist (who was just asleep at 10pm). plenty of restaurants nearby. minutes to metro. recommend getting a better hotel if this is your first stay.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: mcruley
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this property for a couple of nights during a business trip. A good quality/price ratio. Small rooms but ok. Wife for free. Advice: breakfast is scarce, overpriced (12 Euros!). Our option, go to the Place d'Italie, 1 minute walk. At the left side of the square there is a typical French bakery that, for less than 5 Euros, will provide you with enough croissants to serve an army. Grab a coffee to go at McDonalds and enjoy it sitting on bench. Otherwise, if raining, you can still have you coffee and croissants inside McDonalds, they do not compain.

Reviews.Title: “Expect to Loose your stuff if you forget any.”
Reviews.Author: Wisam142
Reviews.Content: I booked this room via www.booking.com , I stayed in this Hotel for 2 nights , location is very good in terms of proximity to metro and shopping mall. My Stay was good until I checked out and left the hotel on way to Belgium I remembered that I forgot in the mini bar fridge a chocolate gift ( Price Euro 60) , I called the reception staff ( Name : Bouzid) and I asked him if he can keep for me the chocolate gift until Tuesday , Mr. Bouzid confirmed to me that he will keep and I can pass and receive on Tuesday. On Tuesday I passed by hotel at 7:30 am ( my flight was 9:30 am) to collect the gift , I was surprised by the reception lady who couldn't find any chocolate gift or even had any background of what I am asking for, She tried to call Bouzid on his mobile but it was switched off, She refused to call the guest staying in same room ( # 55) to check if teh chocolate still in the mini bar fridge. I left the hotel heading to CDG airport and I arrived late due to traffic and hardly I could check in. All in all what happened was unprofessional and there is no need for a hotel to be five stars to keep your belongings safe.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good staff, sort of far out of the centre though”
Reviews.Author: Dimpsxxx
Reviews.Content: You sort of get what you pay for here - same as the UK Best Western's! Pleased with what we had though - just a small room with ensuite, very basic but all you need when your not spending any time in the room as you are out exploring the city :) Love Paris a lot! Only problem is (and why I gave 3 stars) is that the hotel is quite far out from the centre - the metro is close and fine to use but was just a bit annoying sometimes (but our own fault!)

Reviews.Title: “It's a 2 or 3 star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: angela123go
Reviews.Content: This is a dingy little hotel, but I didn't expect much from Paris anyway for the money, so not much of a disappointment. The maid let us run out of toilet paper. The front desk seemed unconcerned. They told us she would refill it the next time she cleaned. Good thing I am a prepared traveler. LOL... The beds are hard and pillows flat. If I had the two necessities of a hotel room in my book, my rating would be higher.... 1. A comfortable bed, no 2. bathroom facilities, ran out of TP! The best think was the free Wi-Fi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at De Weha”
Reviews.Author: SonicScorpion
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the De Weha for three nights, having found a great offer on Laterooms. Overall, I was very pleased with the hotel and had a most pleasant stay. The room was nicely painted: maybe not just newly done, but it still had quite a fresh appearance, in nice pastel colours. The bathroom was spotless and featured the usual toiletries, plus shoe-cleaning cloths. A hairdryer was available and I loved the exfoliating soap. The bed was super-clean and very comfortable. The room was on a high floor, with a pleasant view of the avenue below: yes, you could hear some street noise, and I was sometimes aware of the lift outside the room, but nothing was ever loud enough to bother me. The front desk staff were excellent: all very efficient and professional. The gentlemen on the late and early shifts were very pleasant and clearly made the effort to remember the guests' room numbers when handing back the key cards: an important part of good customer service. Other plus points: the hotel was easily accessible by public transport, with the Place d'Italie metro station just a minute's walk away. Although not right in the centre of Paris, there's a choice of three metro lines from the station, with connections to all the major attractions. The TV didn't pick up the full range of channels, but you don't go to Paris to stay in and watch TV, so this didn't worry me. Maybe the desk in the room had seen better days, and there was one occasion when housekeeping omitted to leave any hand towels....but in the overall scheme of things these were very minor niggles and I mention them only to keep the review balanced. The area is very vibrant and features a varied selection of restaurants, ranging from various Asian cuisines through to the ubiquitous McDonalds, so there really is something for everyone. It's a neighbourhood that feels safe, although you should always exercise all the usual commonsense precautions, as you would anywhere else. Anyone who likes shopping would be spoiled for choice in the massive Italie 2 shopping centre, which is right across the road. I liked the De Weha very much and would certainly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: marjoriepeg
Reviews.Content: Absolutely great location, yards from the Metro. The line that goes straight to Charles De Gaul Airport or Garde Nord for Eurostar! The hotel rooms are quite small, but if you book a twin (slightly larger) with beds together anyway. Small fridge, tea and coffee making tray free on request, with as much top up as required. Free Wi Fi. Very efficient air con (needed in Paris in August!) plenty of shops (large shopping mall including massive Carrfour supermarket inside) , plenty of restaurants, cafes. Walking distance to the river, Notre Dame, Jardin de Plants, Jardin De Luxembourg, Rue Mouffitard etc etc. But the Metro line is so convenient you can be anywhere in Paris in minutes. Helpful staff, lift, free luggage storage. Just what is needed at a budget hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelerTads
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with our 18 year old daughter and had a triple room (1 dbl, 1 twin) facing the front. Room was air conditioned, very clean, nicely decorated, with spotless bathroom and well maintained each day. Breakfast was 12 E and not included and so we opted to eat at patisseries along the way or McDs nearby each morning. Very close to the Place d'Italie Metro stop and square. Staff was very helpful. Yes the rooms and lift are small, but when traveling in Europe for this price range, it's expected. Free Internet access worked fine, just needed to pay attention to upper/lower case during access and also may have to renew during your stay. Would recommend and stay there again. Note when booking with hotel you'll pay first day's stay immediately, less taxes, and then settle remaining days plus all taxes on checkout

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel close to Metro”
Reviews.Author: jrmf11
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel in Paris. Only 15 mins from the centre by Metro. We stayed with our young daughter (10 years old) and they put an extra bed in the room. Breakfast was very informal and all the ingredients were fresh. Hotel was quiet at night and we had a great sleep. Part of the Best Western chain. Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: mmora1000
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean and well located Hotel. Overpriced but what isn't in Europe, for what the room costed me I would have probably stayed in a 5 star Hotel in America but I was expecting it, so it wan't a surprise. The staff is very nice and they were very helpful. At the end of the day Paris is great! and our overall experience was fantastic. I would go back to Paris and why not, stay at the Weha Hotel again but I would try to pay less... Marco and Family

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly staff, excellent budget price, close to metro”
Reviews.Author: Paulacooke
Reviews.Content: Myself and 2 daughters (11 and 13) stayed here for a 3 day visit to Paris. The staff are exceptionally helpful and the rooms are small but clean and well kept. I was looking for well priced, easy to reach and safe accomodation and got all three. I would not recommend the Cafe de France on the Place D'Italie though...the food was cold, bland and over priced for what we had. For the same price we ate in Cafe Hugo in the Marais and this was delicious and atmospheric. Ask the hotel staff for their recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisngly good. Great value.”
Reviews.Author: GoCliff
Reviews.Content: I've travelled a lot for business so stayed in dozens of 4 & 5 * hotels so didn't expect too much from Hotel de Weha. I never write hotel reviews but this one impressed me sufficiently to do so. I booked a 3 night stay for family in 3 rooms thru Laterooms and got a great deal. The rooms could be better lit and are certainly not large but the bathrooms and linen are spotlessly clean, the towels fluffy and the maid service good. The breakfast is good value (compared to other hotels) but I confess we didn't try it, preferring to go to a local cafe. The a/c worked fine. The location (Place d' Italie) whilst not right in the middle (30min walk to Notre Dame) is well served by Metro (Lines 6 & 9). The front desk staff were really helpful, especially Stephen, who was on the late shift while we were there. His English was excellent and he did all he could to make our stay comfotrable. If there was a downside, I guess it is the corridors. They are very narrow and I don't think the sound proofing is brilliant but it wasn't an issue for us (I suspect we were the noisey ones - Sorry :o) Don't expect it to be Crown Plaza or Hilton standard because it certainly isn't in their quality or price bracket. But for a good value comfortable hotel I would certainly recommend it. Cliff

Reviews.Title: “Average accommodation at The Weha”
Reviews.Author: lsavoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights at the end of September 2010. We arrived at 9am and were allowed in our room immediately. We appreciated this as we were tired from long flight. Receptionist was kind and accommodating. Room and elevator very small ('tis the norm in France). 3 minutes walk to metro station- perfect for all sightseeing. Several restaurants nearby. Reserved directly through Best Western at a rate of 112Euros. A few small issues with some staff not worth getting into. Also this hotel is on a very busy street, hence the noise. Difficult to get quiet lodging in the city. Loved Paris however...

Reviews.Title: “poor services”
Reviews.Author: WashingtonDCXXX
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights at this hotel which I think I can find a nicer hotel with the same price. I picked this hotel because it's closer to Vietnameses/Chineses areas/restaurants. You can find Pho 14, Pho Song Huong, and Pho Thong down on Rue de Choisy street very close to the hotel. These restaurants have good food and very good prices. Negative about this hotel: 1. They left dirty towels in the bathroom for you. The towels were old and got blood stains on them. 2. The receptionists people are mean and gave me split 2 beds when I reserved 2 single beds and specific put a request for 2 single beds. After I claimed to them, they gave me a room with 1 twin bed and 1 single bed. They said they don't have 2 single beds eventhough from bestwester.com website list that they have 2 single beds. So be careful about this misleading from www.bestwester.com. 3. The room did not have coffee and tea makers unless you asked the receptionist for it. Then they will give you one but you have to take the makers to your room by yourself. 4. The room don't have iron/ironing board. The TV is very small like 22 inches. 5. The elevator is very very small and can only fit 4 persons (minus luggages) 6. You got to pay for breakfast. 7. We have 3 persons which I think I can reserved for 2 single beds. But they charged me for the 3th person which is 15 euro per night. 8. They asked and keep your room key when you leave the room. I think they looked at my room when we left to see how many people stayed in the room. Positive? - Only near great Vietnamese/Chineses foods, if you want to eat asia foods.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, central location near the Latin District, and reasonably priced.”
Reviews.Author: Manowar2002B
Reviews.Content: I was visiting my mom how was directly in the Latin District. This hotel was very nice. Just a 15 minute walk from the Latin District, Notre, Dame, and other tourist destinations. Also a direct Metro connection. Most importantly, the hotel was clean, with a friendly staff who were very helpful. Breakfast was also very nice, although I would like cream or milk with my coffee. I suppose that was just the way the French serve it. You probably have to ask for it extra. The hotel was also reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Don"t stay there!”
Reviews.Author: madmad101
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for 3, me my wife and our grand daughter. The room was small for two people but now they add another bed and they called 3 people room. We left 1/2 of our luggage in the storeroom by the lobby, to be able to move about in the room. The WI HI didn't work for our stay (3 days) non of the 4 people working at the desk never mention that Mac Donald across the street had WI HI free, I discover this last day of my stay. I ask can I pay the van to the airport with a bank card? yes they said; wrong! when they arrived I had to go to a Bank to get cash. Twice they give me the wrong information about other things.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Wet_Coast1
Reviews.Content: This isn't a luxury hotel, but my teenage son and I didn't pay luxury prices! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here, and the Place d'Italie Metro station is a stone's throw away. Our room, 325 see photo from another reviewer, was spotlessly clean - I don't think I've ever seen a cleaner bathroom floor! The airconditioning was heaven during the heat wave, neighbourhood safe and quiet, and the hotel staff was friendly and knowledgeable. Each morning, we went to the Cafe Margaride for breakfast so we could sit outside and watch the Place d'Italie. Also, the cafe has free wifi - critical to a teenager's well being. The neighbourhood is very multi cultural with a choice of Italian, Japanese, Chinese, Indian, and French cuisine. We had dinner at Cafe Margaride one night, and my son said his salmon was the best meal he'd ever had in his life - mom, can you learn how to do this sauce? The gentleman at the front desk very happily ordered a taxi for us to catch the train at Gare du Nord, which cost approx E25. We were very happy in this neighbourhood and would definitely stay at the Weha again, it's friendly and reliable. We didn't use the wifi because it was out of service while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed several times”
Reviews.Author: KiwiinBrighton
Reviews.Content: I have stayed several times here and like the area near Place d'Italia with a direct Metro Line from Gare d'Nord (M5) and easy to get around. The room is basic, I consider large for Parisian standards and it is a three star hotel. Service is excellent, I changed rooms when my tv did not work with no problems at all. If you can get a room not facing the street or on a higher floor as there is a bit of road noise but nothing major in my view. The restaurants are a bit hit and miss in the area but I do like eating at the Japanese one beside the hotel. There is also a nice park just along the road from the hotel which you can reach in a few minutes if you want to see some green space.

Reviews.Title: “OK but check alternatives before paying over â‚¬100”
Reviews.Author: MissYamabuki
Reviews.Content: Staff were correct. Great location - transport hub, nice restaurants and bars in the Butte aux Cailles. Clean and refurbished in 2009. Noise: our room was facing a noisy street. The hotel has put in some good double glazed windows, but you can still hear traffic and sirens in the night. We could hear the lift all night (the engine and the "going down" recorded voice, over and over again). While in the corridor we heard somebody opening a can in their room, as if they were sitting next to us! Rooms can get stuffy and hot even on cold days, but the air conditioning works well. The rooms are very small and basic, no tea/coffee-making facilities. As in many Paris buildings, lift very small. In theory it fits max 4 people, but realistically more like 2 or 3. In an emergency I wouldn't like to have to tackle the steep, narrow, dizzying staircase that really, really, really needs a bannister, but there is no other way out. Reception area is smart, but despite the refurbishment, the rooms don't look particularly new. The bathroom corners are probably the weak point, but it is generally a very clean hotel. Breakfast was disappointing: seemed like cheap fare with the standard continental variety. The white toast on offer is offensive when you think of the wonderful bread you can get anywhere in France! Poor value for money even for Paris, at 170â‚¬ (+12â‚¬ for breakfast) if you are desparate enough to pay the official price. We paid over 120â‚¬, and it was three stars at a stretch. Mind you, I've stayed at a 2* in France that was abismal, and another that was excellent, so until the new 2009 star classification is applied (by 21 July 2012), the star rating is not entirely reliable. The air conditioning gives this hotel the edge over some cheaper hotels, but overall it confirms the idea that you must suspend your previous ideas about value for money if you come to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “absolutly fine for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: KRMoore
Reviews.Content: we stayed for a three day weekend in paris and my partner had booked this hotel on a room only basis. easy to find from the train station and nicely placed on the outskirts of the city but easy reach due to the metro. we were met at the reception area by a very friendly man who spoke very good english (although i attempted my GCSE french from 12 years ago). The room was absolutly fine for the price and location. if i had been staying for a week or two then i would have needed more space for clothes but for a long weekend the single wardrobe and size of room was enough. bathroom was again a little small but was clean and tidy and fresh. i slept excellently, hearing only a couple of emergency sirens but the windows did block out any traffic noise. there was a sign that there was wifi in the room but we did not use it. the television was a nice flat screen with many channels in french however did have BBC world news in english. we watched this in the evening for 20 minutes or so before bed just to keep an eye on the goings on in the world but that was after long days and lovely evening meals.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, great location.”
Reviews.Author: adamharwood
Reviews.Content: The first room that we were assigned was ridiculous. The double bed took up the whole room and the view was of a wall. But they changed our room as soon as we asked and we were very happy for the rest of the week. Very clean and staff was very friendly and helpful. Location was great for us as it was right by the Metro stop and lots of restaurants. This is not a a high end hotel but if your priorities are clean; convenient location and a decent price then I would recommend the Weha

Reviews.Title: “Small but comfortable, excellent desk staff”
Reviews.Author: Non-fly
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 10 nights in July 2009. The rooms are very small compared to North American standards but it was clean and quiet . We were on the back side of the building. Desk staff all spoke very good english and were helpful. Lobby was being remodelled so it was in a non useable state but should be finished now. Excellent location , very close to Place de Italie Metro stop which has a couple of metro lines stopping there. There is a mall right next door with a super market that was very convenient and some shopping as well. Lots of restuarants close by and they were all pretty good, even a Macdonalds and a KFC right across the street if that is what you are looking for. An outdoor market set up just a block away once a week with a little of everything.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: mady_2000
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel very much, it was very clean, the staff was very friendly and helpfull. The prices were ok. The hotel is situated very close to the subway station and there are many restaurants near by, and also a shopping center. The rooms were very small, but very clean. The view was terrible, the window looked to the back of the building (not the main street) and it was above another building roof. We didn't mind this, because we didn't spent that much time in the room. I would stay in tih hotel again because of the location and the good prices.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in nice parisian suburb”
Reviews.Author: kinuk
Reviews.Content: I will definately stay here again and have recommended this hotel to other friends who have all been very happy with it. Whilst not flash, it is very good value for money in paris. Yes rooms are small, but so is every room in paris. On the upside, it is a lovely small hotel that really makes you feel like you are staying in paris rather than some large trendy chain hotel. It has friendly english speaking staff and best of all it is located in a lovely suburban area. Is a 10 min walk to the latin quarter and has a metro station 2 min walk from the hotel. Will take around 10 mins to get into the centre of paris on the metro. Also has a large shopping centre right next to the hotel which was handy for buying lots of delicious food from the supermarket!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for a Best Western”
Reviews.Author: ClemBrussels
Reviews.Content: I have come to trust best Western. They have a zillion hotels in Paris and I tried many of them - but this one is not really BW material. Everything is barely "ok" but my room was a glorified cupboard and the quality of the breakfast was definitely not ok. The unfriendliness and unhelpfullness of the woman at the front desk set a whole new standard, even for Paris. But hey, don't worry. Best Western has a zillion-1 better hotels in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel gives the Best Western Chain a Bad Name”
Reviews.Author: Chintz2175
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to go to Paris for the first time for 5 nights with my husband. I wanted to stay at a decent priced hotel in an area near the metro. The Best Western De Weha looked pretty good online, and there weren't really any bad reviews considering all the reviews I read about other hotels in Paris. The only thing good I have to say about the Best Western De Weha is that it is close to the Place D'Italie Metro station. I was very disappointed in all aspects of this hotel because the lobby area was very shabby and definitely needs some renovating or heavy duty cleaning. The elevator/lift was a joke. It was like a tiny closet and could barely fit 2 people let alone your luggage. When we arrived to our floor, I pratically triped out of the elevator and our room door was right there. On top of that, we are in complete darkness as the lights on our floor were out. I asked the front desk about that and he responded, "Oh you have to turn on the switch". I said, "that is not what I am asking... why were they out?" and he just repeated, "You have to turn on the switch". I think this is totally ridicilous. It is one thing to conserve energy but another to neglect customer safety. Someone could get robbed or trip and get hurt like I did. I tripped and just about hit the door. When we got to our room, it was the size of a prison cell and my husband couldn't even go to the bedroom with the door shut as his legs were hitting the door. I understand that rooms in Paris are relatively small, but this takes the cake. Not to mention we paid about $260 USD per night for this (this was the cheapest hotel that our travel agent gave us that was nearby the metro)! What upset us even more is on our first night there, we got woken up out of a sound sleep at 1:30 AM from a loud fire alarm. Being from New York and having to deal with the September 11th tragedy, I can't begin to tell you the panic that came over us. My husband and I jumped out of bed and ran downstairs & on to the street in our PJ's. The hotel manager on staff told us that it was due to the building getting too hot and caused the fire alarm to go off. He didn't even say sorry. He said it like I was supposed to be ok with this response. Yes I was thankful it wasn't an actual fire, but my nerves were shot after that, and I couldn't go back to sleep. Also the fire alarm was on for about 1/2 hour straight so where the heck was the fire brigade to check things out? That was not comforting at all! The next morning I tried to complain how unhappy we were about the fire alarm and the room size, etc. The woman on staff had no sympathy whatsoever. I asked her if she could move us to a different Best Western as they are all over Paris. With an attitude, she said, "This is a separate entity, and I need to call the Travel Agency." She also said, "This is Paris, what do I expect". Our room was prepaid through our Travel Agency or I would have checked out immediately. Also we probably wouldn't be able to get our money back until after we got home as it would have to be credited (and we know how long it takes to get money back), and I didn't have any extra money to spare on another hotel expense as we were on a very tight budget. The next night no fire alarm went off (thank goodness), but a drunk local outside was screaming his head off. Who could sleep at this hotel? I am from NY so I am used to noise, but this was ridicilous with a Capital R!!! This will be the last time I prepay for a hotel, and I am writing a letter to Best Western as this hotel is giving them a bad name. So disappointed with our stay here and in all my travels over the years, this hotel gets the award for worst hotel stay ever!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing in Spades”
Reviews.Author: izone
Reviews.Content: I and my two friends booked the hotel for two nights and we assumed a Best Western three stars would meet our requirements. When we entered the lobby of the hotel it was clear this was no where near representative of a three star establishment. The rug in the hallway was so worn out I can not imagine a less three star level of cleanliness. This was a worn out and shabby lobby. It was located on a very busy street and the room assigned to us was above the bus line terminus; the traffic of big, loaded trucks and buses was non-stop. The fumes and pollution was so thick I got a sore throat. I have stayed several times in two star hotels off Goblins street a few minutes from this hotel and they were spotless, the rooms clean and bright. Besides, when I asked the receptionist for an extra pillow because the pillow was so thin, he had to wrap the pillow in a cloth because he did not have an extra pillow case. We decided to leave the hotel the next day. When we asked the receptionist to call a cab he was not able to get a cab to the hotel. The receptionist sent us to the taxi line near the hotel but did not alert us that there would be a long wait at the taxi line near the hotel (we had a train to catch at Gare de Lyon). If a helpful Parisian did not suggest taking a bus we would have missed our train, too. Terrible experience, not a three star level of room or service, and very noise and polluted.

Reviews.Title: “Far more positives than negatives”
Reviews.Author: JackCharlton
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 5 nights at the Hotel De Weha. The staff were excellent, very friendly and our room was very clean. The hotel is set in close proximity to the Place D'Italie which is a great place to stay. Everything you could need is on your doorstep. A wonderful shopping centre named Italie 2, a selection of good quality restaurants in the nearby Avenue Des Gobelins and Metro and bus links within 150 yards of the hotel's front door. Yes it can be noisy, but you don't visit a city centre expecting to hear birds singing and the sound of babbling brooks! If you do want an oriental meal there is an oriental district not too far away. We found that area and its people equally welcoming. We hope to return to the Hotel De Weha and the Place D'Italie.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely if you're looking for a good location and are on a budget”
Reviews.Author: hea27
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Hotel de Weha in Paris three times now. It seems that we've forgotten to review it after each stay, though it's better late than never - especially after reading some of the reviews on here. We have visited from London UK on the Eurostar, each time arriving late at night. This hasn't been a problem as the hotel is very near to Place d'Italie (south of the river, end of #5 orange metro line), and you can catch the #5 Metro direct from Gare du Nord. This journey, which is direct, takes approximately 30 minutes. Rate: â‚¬60-70 / Â£50-60 (plus applicable discounts from online booking agencies, one free night etc.) Room: clean, quaint, small and cosy, comfortable bed, television, window and view of the tree-lined street. Breakfast: not included (there are several boulangeries and cafes found off Place d'Italie) Location: great, plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby, a shopping complex too (supermarket, department store, food). One minute from Place d'Italie Metro so very well linked to the rest of the city. We've been so pleased staying here. The place is clean and the staff are friendly. We've stayed at two other places in Paris and, if looking for something in the same price range, would return here without doubt. If we were able to spend more money, eg if we were looking for luxury for a very special occasion, we would look elsewhere. Not because you can't have a special time here, just because it's simply doesn't offer luxury. If you visit expecting a small but clean and cosy room that is a Metro ride away from the Eiffel Tower (direct on the #3 pale green line, approx 20 minutes away) and most other major sites, close to a supermarket so you can stock up on well priced snacks, but is within walking distance to nice restaurants filled with locals not tourists, well you'll enjoy it here.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful hotel”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghJ
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because the Best Western website said it was located in the Latin Quarter. It was no where near it! I have stayed in Best Western hotels throughout Europe on business and they have all been excellent. This couldn't be further from those standards. The room was so small we struggled to get our suitcases in. The noise from traffic outside was unbelievable and the staff were rude and unhelpful. The final straw was when after having a bath, the mechanism to drain the water failed to work, my partner went downstairs to ask the night porter for assistance. He said it wasn't his problem and turned his back on him. We checked out the next morning and got a taxi to Notre Dame (in the district we had originally chosen and the one the website said Hotel Weha was located in) and found a wonderful hotel on the Ile St Louis.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: DaveSKeighley
Reviews.Content: Very small hotel only about half a dozen rooms on each floor. Found the reception staff helpful. Booked it on the Easyjet site and found breakfast was included. Breakfast, usual continental and plenty. Nice and central, very handy for Metro. A large shopping arcade round the corner. Rooms clean, small and fairly cramped. A/C not working but not too hot when we were there, can see it could be uncomfortable in the heat. Tiny lift just squeeze two people in it. Double bed, comfortable enough. Good value in my book - I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: alliisclassy
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the location advertised and for the air conditioning. They say it is in the Latin Quarter. Infact, it is in Chinatown about 4 to 5 long blocks or 15 minutes from the Latin Quarter. The a/c was being redone and was not available for over a month. I wonder if they have ever had a/c. It was very hot during our stay. The lights in the hallways and stairwells are turned off unless you find the light switch and turn them on which is a little scary coming off the elevator into darkness. The receptionist spoke limited english and was very unaccomodating. They have a safe in the room and they charge you 2 euros per day to use it. the beds are twin, but actually smaller than twin size. our mattress had water stains. the rooms were extremely tiny with only 2 feet between the beds and 2 feet in front of the beds. go somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: chrissw
Reviews.Content: Having seen all the other reviews of this hotel we were expecting a poor experience. We ended up here as part of a Eurostar plus hotel deal booked on the Eurostar website. However we were pleasantly surprised that many of the things people complain about here just didn't turn out to be true. I wonder what people are expecting of an inexpensive hotel in an expensive city? People should perhaps know that there are indeed regulations governing the minimum amount of space per guest, but that in France the space is the smallest in Europe. So in Paris, where real estate is extremely expensive, it's no surprise that hotels will use every bit of space they have. It may be slightly facetious of me to say so, but the USA has a lot more space, and probably a lot less expensively. Firstly when we arrived at the hotel we were welcomed very warmly, and the receptionist offered us a map of Paris and pointed out a few of the most important sights. She spoke good English. We met some of the other staff during our stay and if anything, they were even more friendly. On reaching the room on the first floor we were again exepcting the worst, but it was absolutely fine. It was decorated in a pleasant purple in two shades, and, while it was clear that the furniture was of the inexpensive type (especially the bathroom door) it was spotlessly clean, from the carpet up to the ceiling. The bathroom itself was again very clean and fitted to a high standard; in many ways this was the high point of the room. The hotel provided toiletries for us to use. We needed some additional pillows (I don't know how French people ever sleep on just one tiny pillow, which seems to be the norm in France!) and these were provided with no problem. Yes, the double bed was in fact two singles pushed together; I have been to a number of hotels in Europe where this is the case. We were in a first floor room at the front of the hotel, facing the Avenue de Choisy. This is a busy road with many shops and it would be very noisy with the window open. However the room has an air-conditioning unit which obviously means that you would need to keep the window closed in order to get the benefit from it. We didn't use the hotel restaurant for breakfast, since 11 Euros for breakfast seemed very expensive. However, we would recommend the Patisserie-Salon de The on the other side of the Avenue de Choisy. It is run by a Chinese family; the gentleman serving both days we used it spoke good English. There are a number of set-price breakfasts available, and patisseries to die for. Regarding the hotel location: it is not central. However again I would ask why people have such a problem with this? There is a Metro station two minutes' walk away, with frequent trains to anywhere you may want to go (personally I think riding on the Metro is an essential part of the Paris experience but not everyone may share that opinion!) If you intend using the Metro, buy a book of 10 tickets at once (known as a "Carnet") because it's quite a bit cheaper than buying individual tickets. The area itself is built up and modern, and yes, it is true that it isn't really in the Latin Quarter, and there are a lot of Chinese and Japanese residents in the area. However we didn't find it unpleasant. There is a fairly large shopping centre ("Centre Commercial") just a minute's walk away. Our main problem with this hotel is the general level of internal noise. The walls seem quite thin and there was quite a lot of activity from time to time.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to Write Home About”
Reviews.Author: LMcTetbury
Reviews.Content: Disappointing hotel - been to Paris a few times, and you don't get much for your money, but this was really pokey and our room had the WORST lime-green walls ... yeugh! Right on a v.busy street in the CHINESE QUARTER (not Latin), but close to the Metro, so you can get outta the area v.quickly - and you'll want to, unless you're into chinese food, tacky shops and the cinema. From the tiny lift to the tiny bedrooms (ours was the largest on the floor and we felt v.sorry for everybody else), to the rather miserable staff - not much to write home about. I have nothing good to say about this hotel I'm afraid. You're better off looking for something closer to the centre, even though you may pay more - at least you'l be closer to "where its at".

Reviews.Title: “convinient, clean budget accomodation”
Reviews.Author: mungs
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from our weekend trip to Paris (aug 2006 ). Had checked in double room which we thought was bit small , but clean with refrigerator in the room . The hotel is well located in terms of 2min to metro and convinient in visting the tourist destinations . Also close to shopping mall , cash machine, kfc , mc donald closeby . The staff at the reception was good and helpful . if on budget ,I definately recommed this hotel . cheers mungs

Reviews.Title: “Mediocrity never killed anyone”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two nights after I got a decent rate via an Internet booking site. The hotel room was clean although small (but most Parisian hotel rooms are). The neighborhood is pretty good - convenient to the Metro, near a big shopping center, with lots of restaurants and cafÃ©s nearby. Place d'Italie is not touristy at all - it's a neighborhood where real Parisians live and as such you might actually have an authentic experience with the locals, and it's very near the Butte aux Cailles which is an interesting location and the Jardin des Plantes, well worth visiting. Considering that the room rate was good and that the location was very practical for what I was doing (attending a conference nearby) I was happy. And the room was airconditioned, a definite plus in Paris in June. The only unpleasant part was that the breakfast buffet is hideously expensive (11 euros) and the food (some cereal, basic yogurt, a few slices of ham and processed cheese) is below average. Milk in a jug had gone sour, coffee comes out of a self-serve dispenser, and the general atmosphere is depressing. Save your money, and go out (either across the street to a bakery that offers breakfast, or buy some croissants in the area and have coffee on a sidewalk cafe). I doubt I'll go back - something a little too impersonal about the hotel and the sour milk put me off. This is a mediocre little hotel - won't kill you, especially at that price, but if you are looking for a great memory, you might want to stay away.

Reviews.Title: “So so hotel but serves the purpose”
Reviews.Author: sag42
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at BW Hotel De Weha. First the good things about the hotel: (1) The location is not bad. 5 min walking distance from the place d' italie metro station. Walk towards the McDonald and KFC. Lot of resturants and a very big mall with a grocery store in the basement. This is a huge advantage if you want to buy some food and drinks to save money. (2) Friendly staff. (3) Very clean room and bathroom (4) Reasonably priced. We paid 80e per night (does not include taxes). Now what we did not like: (1) The room is very small, even small for euorpean standards. Only London has rooms smaller than this. My wife and I could not move around at the same time inside the room. (2) The bathroom is also very small but serves the purpose. (3) The tv programs are really bad, not a single english language channel and no CNN either. So, you better take a book to read. (4) Not clearly worded practices by the management. For example, there is a small fridge with food and drinks and they also keep a wine bottle with chips and peanuts on the desk. We thought this was the compliments of the hotel. I have stayed in many many Best Western hotels for hundreds of nights and this is only hotel that charged us for eating the peanuts and chips left by the hotel on the desk. No where it is mentioned that we will be charged. We did not go near the fridge at all. At the same time it is our mistake to assume that food on the desk is free. We should have asked I guess. Lessons learnt!!! We did complain to the management and they did not even care to listen to us. They ended up charging us an arm and a leg for that. On the whole this is not a bad hotel but I would not stay here again. I think I can find something better for the same price. Acutally we did. For one night at the end of our journey we stayed at the BW Nouvel Orleans which is so much better and opposite to the metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Good and clean Hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: Raminos
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights in May 2006. It is situated close to the Asian and Latin sectors of Paris. By Asian I mean the Chinese, Vietnamese and Japanese community. The location of the hotel is very good as it is about 5 minutes walk from the Metro. I really recommend visiting the Latin quarter as very lively and lots of bars and night life in Paris is great. As for the rooms, they were very clean. However, at times the rooms can get noisy, if you have noisy neighbours as the walls are not on the thick side. Decent size bathrooms and rooms come with a TV although only 5 channels, however, we spent about 5 minutes in total watching the TV. We did not have the breakfast as it was not included in our package (Through Eurostar) but it looked decent enough. All rooms are air conditioned and can be controlled via a remote. The bathrooms have towels replaced daily and come with a bath tub and shower along with a hair dryer. If you want a cheap, clean and good location and friendly staff, this one is for you. If you want luxury then you need to spend more and probably a lot more.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and affordable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel May 19-22nd and loved it. Look, it is not the Four Seasons, OK? But I went through Expedia and it cost approx. $60 US per night. For that price we got an immaculate room, very comfortable bed, refridgerator in room, and steps away from the Metro station. Of course there's a downside: the room was small, but we only were in the room from midnight to 9:00 a.m.. The breakfast didn't look apetizing but there was a McD's across the street. Summary: if you're just looking for a place to crash, this is it. The private bathroom was so clean it looked like they just built it. I just read some reviews that don't jive with what I saw so I had to write in.

Reviews.Title: “Shop around - You'll do better for your money”
Reviews.Author: UkCheerie
Reviews.Content: Room was small and cramped and cleanliness wasn't up to scratch on our arrival (hairs in bath - urgh !!). Hair dryer didn't work. Shop around before staying here, I'm sure we could have done a lot better for the money. There's a Holiday Inn Express round the corner !! The worst thing about our stay was that my iPod went missing from our room. Of course non of the cleaners or staff knew anything about this. This effectively added an extra Â£300 to our stay !! Watch them valuables !!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel if your on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Jenny123
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to stay in a hotel in the city rather than at the airport because I heard so many horror stories about how small the hotels are and it that it would be impossible to find a decent hotel "rodent free" under $100.00US. NOT TRUE! Hotel De Weha was a decent little hotel for the money. I booked thru hotels.com and got the rate of about 84.00 bucks a night. Not bad. I am certain that many other hotels in the area were a lot more expensive with the same accommodations. So here is the scoop: Hotel De Weha is clean. The rooms are nicely painted. I found the bathroom to be small but very very clean. The linens on the bed were also clean. The only downside was that it was very cold in Paris in March and the heater in the room was the pits. I am sure they would have switched us to a different room but my husband and I were too lazy to pack up and move to a different room. The staff was very helpful! Virginia the Receptionist was great and so was the night shift manager(I forgot his name but he is an African man from Mali). We had no difficulty getting around Paris as the Metro train stop is less than one block away. There are great restaurants in the area as well. Make sure you check out the Farmers Market that takes place on Sunday mornings next to the Mall (WOW!!!). This was our first time in Paris and over all I think we made a right choice with Hotel De Weha. I would stay here again (especially when the weather warms up).

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Hotel De Weha
HotelInfo.Address: 205 Avenue De Choisy | 13th Arr, 75013 Paris, France
